alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Houghton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 11 at 8:05PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Michigan... Sturgeon River near Chassell affecting Baraga and Houghton Counties. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases upstream will result in high water along the Sturgeon River near Chassell. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by snowmelt are occurring. * WHERE...Sturgeon River near Chassell. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, The river begins to overflow onto Sturgeon River Road...Rajala Road...and Aho Road * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:20 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 8.9 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. However, river water levels are expected to continue rising. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.
